definition: suffix of a noun of locality
to protect/to defend/to guard against/to prevent

sentences.english: Science construction border defense emergency military action organization command structure.
sentences.chinese: 科學構建邊防應急軍事行動組織指揮體系。

sentences.english: The frontier guards together with the militiamen drove out the invaders.
sentences.chinese: 邊防戰士和民兵一起把入侵者趕了出去。

sentences.english: Part four discusses the construction of border on the impact of border trade between Guangxi and Vietnam.
sentences.chinese: 第四部分論述邊防建設對桂越邊貿的影響。

sentences.english: The Fei Bin is defending the whip son of river's vegetable and seeing toward the summer rather.
sentences.chinese: 斐彬一邊防着江素的鞭子，一邊看向夏寧。

sentences.english: The border guards are on guard.
Our frontier guards held up under fierce enemy attack .
sentences.chinese: 我們的邊防戰士在敵人猛烈進攻下巍然不動。

sentences.english: Some of the border guards, who had patrolled the barrier day in day out, saw it as a provocation.
sentences.chinese: 一些日夜在此巡邏的邊防兵，將這視爲一種挑釁。

sentences.english: The art troupe is always on the move in frontier guards.
sentences.chinese: 文工團常年在邊防部隊流動。

sentences.english: His army is stationed near the border line.
sentences.chinese: 他所在的部隊就駐紮在邊防線附近。

sentences.english: Soldiers with Pakistan's Frontier Corps practice shooting.
sentences.chinese: 士兵和巴基斯坦邊防部隊一起練習射擊。

sentences.english: The frontier station was starved for food and water.
There wasn't even a border post until around 1850.
sentences.chinese: 在1850年前，這裏甚至都沒有邊防哨所。

sentences.english: Day and night, frontier guards defend our motherland's border areas.
sentences.chinese: 邊防戰士們日日夜夜守衛着祖國的邊疆。

sentences.english: Our frontier guards, fighting in self-defence, threw back the invading troops.
sentences.chinese: 我邊防戰士在自衛戰中打退了入侵的軍隊。

sentences.english: No organization or individual may obstruct the frontier inspector from lawfully executing his duties.
sentences.chinese: 任何組織和個人不得妨礙邊防檢查人員依法執行公務。
